nodes.text: Clone B-2332-54 is a short story written by Eric S. Trautmann for The Last Command Sourcebook, published in 1994. It was reprinted in The Thrawn Trilogy Sourcebook in 1996.

In 3 ABY, shortly after the fateful Duel on Cloud City, an Ugnaught worker in Cloud City's Smelting Core D named Groggin discovers the severed hand of Luke Skywalker along with the Jedi's lightsaber among a pile of rubbish. As Groggin goes to melt down the lightsaber, the Sith Lord Darth Vader enters the Smelting Core and demands Groggin to give him the severed hand. Groggin, ignorant as to who he is speaking with, demands 2,000 credits in payment for the hand. Vader proceeds to Force Choke Groggin to death and takes the severed hand, still holding Skywalker's lightsaber. As Vader boards his shuttle to take the hand and weapon to the Emperor, he briefly considers cloning Skywalker from the cells in the severed hand and taking the clone on as his apprentice, but Darth Sidious senses Vader's deception and orders him to take the hand and lightsaber to the storehouse at Mount Tantiss on Wayland.
